comment.body: Ummm, (no wait that's bad news) ahhhhhh, (not that either). What good thing happened recently actually? I'm having trouble due to all the crap that's been going on in RL. New Anime season maybe? Invader Zim is coming back? TeamFourStar got DMCAd agai- No that's bad again.

@Rythyrix: Even if W3C doesn't add EME to the offcial spec, it doesn't really mean much. There's no punishment or anything for browser makers that add functions outside of spec, and most of the browsers have already added EME support. Regardless of how W3C rules, DRM is part of the web already, which sucks.
How about "**z**i**m**s"? Top 3 google results seem relevant XD

Italian what? Zites? Italian ZeroTalk can be found [here](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1MxvDmGn5fipn7cyjXAMyMZPH3SyhwfZkw/). You can change ZeroNet's default language to Italian in three-dot menu in ZeroHello.
Backup, Backup, Backup, Backup, Backup, Backup, Backup, Backup, Backup, Backup, Backup, Backup, Backup, Backup, Backup, Backup
Whichever you feel more comfortable in. That's usually the best. Though if you feel up to it you can post in both and accept all.

@ScrubTheSecond: Money? Just put the stuff in a password protected archive and upload it to something like Google Drive or Mega. At the very least backup your keys to things, like your ZeroNet IDs.

Or did you think I meant data recovery? Not sure what kind of damage your HDD sustained, but if it was a simple overwrite/reformatting you could try things like Testdisk or Photorec to try and recover a few things.

Cortana seems to be getting worse for me with every Windows update, not better. Can't even get her to tell me the weather anymore, which is what I mostly used her for.
I literally spat out my drink when I read that headline. So absurd.

It would get cumbersome way too quickly since it's mainly designed around the idea of using symbols and shorthands to create formatting that a human can use. In the end we'll probably end up with something similar to HTML and CSS, if not just flat out use HTML and CSS.
@Tomas: That's weird. Any examples? I've never seen anybody use it like that.
Pretty easy to write a Greasemonkey/Stylish script for that.

@Tomas: Ah, I see that. Works well if you're just making a simple thing for the net. Manuals and Online texts would work well with that. Still don't think it could replace everything a word document can do though, especially when it comes to more complex formatting.
@Tomas: Sure, but in the mean time it can be a nice stop gap.
@Krixano: Sure it can be cumbersome, but there's a limit to how much you can do with markdown before it becomes equally cumbersome.
